p: Dengue control traditionally consumes a substantial proportion of the generally limited human and financial means of a large number of countries yet often fails to curb epidemics early enough. In addition, Zika and chikungunya epidemics are now occurring in dengue-endemic areas, further burdening already overstretched health systems. Therefore, more investments are needed into research to identify what really works and how—and should thus be implemented—and what does not, and is a waste of resources.
